title: Hurrem Sultan
summary: Hurrem Sultan (Turkish pronunciation: [hyɾˈɾæm suɫˈtan], Ottoman Turkish: حُوریم سلطان‎, romanized: Ḫurrem Sulṭān, Modern Turkish: Hürrem Sultan; c. 1502 – 15 April 1558), also known as Roxelana (Ukrainian: Роксолана; lit. 'the Ruthenian one'), was the chief consort and wife of the  Ottoman sultan Suleiman the Magnificent. She became one of  most powerful and influential women in Ottoman history as well as a prominent and controversial figure during the era known as the Sultanate of Women.
